text:
* Pat Cummins, the Australian cricket team captain, will play in the second season of Major League Cricket (MLC) and will captain the San Francisco Unicorns team.
* Cummins replaces Aaron Finch, who led the San Francisco Unicorns in the first season and has since retired from cricket.
* The second season of MLC will start from July 5, right after the T20 World Cup 2024.
* The first day of the tournament will feature a doubleheader match, with the first match being played between defending champions Seattle Orcas and MI New York.
* The International Cricket Council (ICC) has granted List A cricket status to Major League Cricket, which is expected to attract more cricketers to participate in the tournament.

**Key Points:**

* The International Cricket Council (ICC) has granted the Major League Cricket (MLC) official List-A status.
* This recognition comes ahead of the MLC's second season, which starts on July 5.
* The List-A status acknowledges the MLC as an official T20 league and the first world-class domestic tournament in the United States.
* The tournament's official statistics will now be internationally recognized, providing US players with opportunities for international recognition.
* The MLC is the first professional Twenty20 cricket championship in the United States, featuring six teams: Los Angeles Knight Riders, MI New York, San Francisco Unicorns, Seattle Orcas, Texas Super Kings, and the Washington Freedom.

**Recognition**: MLC has acquired List A status from the ICC, making it an official T20 league, and tournament playing records will now be counted as official format statistics.

**2024 Season**: The 2024 edition of MLC will start on July 5 and will feature 25 games. The tournament will be played across two grounds: Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas and Church Street Park Stadium in Morrisville.

**Expansion Plans**: MLC plans to expand from six teams to 10 teams over the next few years, with the goal of hosting 34 games by 2025.

**Schedule**: The ideal calendar for MLC is to start in early June, avoiding clashes with the Hundred and T20 Blast. However, this year's schedule will overlap with the Hundred, with the MLC ending on July 28 and the Hundred starting on July 23.

**Teams and Ownership**: Four of the six teams in the MLC are owned by IPL team owners, including Mumbai Indians, KKR, Chennai Super Kings, and Delhi Capitals.

* Australian captain Pat Cummins will play for San Francisco Unicorns in the second edition of the MLC in the USA.
* Cummins will lead the side after Aaron Finch's retirement and will be available for three weeks, starting five days after the T20 World Cup.
* He joins other Australian players who have signed for MLC season 2, including Travis Head, Glenn Maxwell, Spencer Johnson, Steve Smith, and Jake Fraser Mcgurk.
* Other Australians, such as Mitchell Marsh and Marcus Stoinis, are also expected to join the tournament.
* The MLC season 2 will begin on July 6, with the reigning champions MI New York taking on Seattle Orcas in Morrisville, and Texas Super Kings facing LA Knight Riders in Texas.

* Commvault, a leading provider of cyber resilience and data protection solutions, has announced its sponsorship of the MI New York, the defending champions of Major League Cricket (MLC).
* The MI New York team is part of the MI family, which has won 10 titles across various leagues around the world.
* The team will kick off the season on July 5th, and Commvault will feature its logo on jerseys, stadium signage, and across TV and social media platforms.
* Commvault's sponsorship will also include exclusive watch parties, contests, and cricket clinics with professional players, as well as tickets offered to local charitable initiatives.
* The partnership aims to bring the excitement of cricket to new audiences and demonstrate the importance of resilience both on and off the field.
* Commvault's collaboration with MI New York serves as an opportunity to educate an untapped global fanbase about the importance of resilience in both personal and professional life.

* Commvault, a leading provider of cyber resilience and data protection solutions, has announced its sponsorship of MI New York, the defending champions of Major League Cricket (MLC).
* MI New York is a T20 cricket team that plays in the Major League Cricket and is part of the MI family, which has won 10 titles across various leagues across the world.
* The team is the inaugural and defending champion of MLC, having established itself in 2023.
* The sponsorship will feature opportunities to engage with fans, including exclusive watch parties, contests, and cricket clinics with professional players.
* The season is set to kick off on July 5th, and fans can tune in to support the MI New York team.

The USA cricket team won their first-ever T20 World Cup game against Canada, thanks to a brilliant unbeaten 94 from Aaron Jones. The match was played in front of a passionate crowd of 7,000 at the purpose-built stadium, which is also the home of Major League Cricket. The win was a significant milestone for cricket in the USA, where the sport is not widely popular. The tournament organizers hope to increase the sport's popularity in the country. The crowd was largely made up of Indian-Americans, but there were also some local Americans who were attending their first cricket match. The USA team will next face Pakistan in a tougher test of their skills. Jones, the star of the match, is confident that his team can play fearless cricket and make a mark in the tournament.

**Tournament Status**: Cognizant Major League Cricket (MLC) has been awarded List-A status by the ICC, making it America's first world-class domestic tournament.

**Teams and Players**: The league consists of six teams: Los Angeles Knight Riders, MI New York, San Francisco Unicorns, Seattle Orcas, Texas Super Kings, and Washington Freedom. A total of 45 MLC players will participate in the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2024.

**Players Participating in ICC Men's T20 World Cup**: The article lists all 45 MLC players participating in the World Cup, categorized by team. These players represent countries such as the USA, West Indies, Bangladesh, South Africa, Australia, Ireland, Afghanistan, New Zealand, and Pakistan.

**Tournament Impact**: The MLC has already made a significant impact on the cricket landscape in the USA, with its inaugural 2023 season being a huge success. The league's second season is set to kick off on July 5.

**Upcoming Events**: The ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2024 will take place in the USA and West Indies from June 1 to 29, 2024.

* The San Francisco Unicorns, one of the eight franchises in the USA-based Major League Cricket (MCL), has signed Pakistani spinner Abrar Ahmed ahead of the league's second season.
* The second season of the MCL is scheduled to start in mid-July 2024.
* Abrar Ahmed is a significant acquisition for the San Francisco Unicorns, bringing his experience and skills as a reliable spinner in the T20 format.

* Pat Cummins, the Australian Test and ODI captain, will play for the San Francisco Unicorns in the second season of MLC.
* Cummins' participation in the MLC will begin after the conclusion of the T20 World Cup 2024.
* The MLC has been granted A-listed status by the ICC and will start on July 5 with a doubleheader featuring the defending champions MI New York against Seattle Orcas in Morrisville.

* Australian cricket captain Pat Cummins has signed with the San Francisco Unicorns franchise for the second season of the MLC tournament.
* Cummins will join his team ahead of the tournament, which begins five days after the end of the T20 World Cup.
* Other top Australian players who have joined the tournament include Travis Head, Glenn Maxwell, Spencer Johnson, Steve Smith, and Jake Fraser-McGurk.
* The San Francisco Unicorns have a strategic relationship with Victoria's first-class cricket setup, while the Washington Freedom, coached by Ricky Ponting, are linked to Cricket NSW.
* A "proxy war" is developing between Victoria and New South Wales in the MLC, with the two franchises set to play each other on July 22nd in Grand Prairie, Texas.

* Australian captain Pat Cummins will play for the San Francisco Unicorns in the second season of MLC, taking on a leadership role after Aaron Finch's retirement.
* The MLC season starts on July 5 with a doubleheader featuring defending champions MI New York and Seattle Orcas, followed by a game between Texas Super Kings and LA Knight Riders.
* Other Australian players participating in the tournament include Travis Head, Glenn Maxwell, Spencer Johnson, Steve Smith, Jake Fraser-McGurk, and possibly Mitchell Marsh, Marcus Stoinis, and other World Cup squad members.
* The addition of top-tier stars like Cummins highlights the growing prominence of MLC in world cricket.

* Aaron Jones, who was not picked in the last MLC draft, showcased his skills with a 40-ball 94, leading USA to a convincing seven-wicket victory over Canada.
* Jones was released by MLC franchise Seattle Orcas after the inaugural edition, but he believes he is good enough to play at the highest level and hopes his performance will open the eyes of those who doubted him.

* Afghanistani batter Rahmanullah Gurbaz, who has played in various franchise leagues including the MLC, is a key player to watch. He has been successful in the powerplay, taking on seam bowlers and punishing overpitched deliveries.

**Key Players**: Pat Cummins, the Australian skipper, has signed up for the San Francisco Unicorns, replacing Aaron Finch. Other Australian players participating in the tournament include Travis Head, Glenn Maxwell, Spencer Johnson, Steve Smith, Jake Fraser Mcgurk, Mitchell Marsh, and Marcus Stoinis.

**Tournament Schedule**: MLC 2024 is scheduled to commence on July 5 and will run until July 28. The group stage will consist of 21 matches, with each team playing 7 fixtures, from July 5 to July 23. The knockout stage will take place from July 24 to July 28, featuring four fixtures: Eliminator (July 24), Qualifier (July 25), Challenger (July 26), and the final (July 28).

* Kolkata Knight Riders, the champions of the 16th IPL season, are eyeing another title in the Major League Cricket (MLC) tournament in the USA.
* As part of their preparations, they have acquired the services of power-hitter David Miller, who will play for the Los Angeles Knight Riders, a sister franchise of the Kolkata Knight Riders.
* Miller had previously played for the Gujarat Titans in the IPL and had a successful stint with them.
* The MLC tournament is scheduled to start on July 5, and the Kolkata Knight Riders are looking to make a mark in the tournament with their strong squad, including Andrew Russell and Sunil Narine.

Overall, the article highlights the preparations of the Kolkata Knight Riders for the upcoming MLC tournament and their plans to make a strong impact in the competition.

The Seattle Orcas, a Major League Cricket team, has appointed Hemant Dua as its new Chief Executive Officer. Dua brings over 25 years of experience in the sports and entertainment industries and will lead the team into its second season in July. He was previously the Managing Director and CEO of Inspiranti Sports and held leadership positions at GMR Sports Pvt. Ltd and Octagon. As CEO, Dua will implement the club's strategic vision, drive revenue and commercial opportunities, and focus on innovation, on-field success, and growth of the sport in the Pacific Northwest region.

* The second edition of the Major League Cricket tournament is scheduled to take place from July 5th to July 28th.
* Australian cricket team captain Pat Cummins has signed with the San Francisco Unicorns for the upcoming season.
* In the inaugural edition of the tournament in 2023, the San Francisco Unicorns finished 5th in the table with 4 points from five matches.
* Several Australian players, including Steve Smith, Travis Head, Nathan Ellis, Lance Morris, Glenn Maxwell, and Andrew Tye, will be participating in the tournament.
* The current champions of the tournament are MI New York, who won the inaugural season in a one-sided final.
* Pat Cummins and other Australian players have faced travel hassles, including lost baggage and long transit times, while traveling from the West Indies after the T20 World Cup.

* The San Francisco Unicorns, a franchise in the USA-based Major League Cricket (MCL), have signed Pakistani spinner Abrar Ahmed ahead of the league's second season.
* Abrar Ahmed is a rising star in international cricket, having taken 17 wickets in just four Test appearances and representing Pakistan in the T20 World Cup squad.
* He has also showcased his skills in the Pakistan Super League (PSL), taking 16 wickets in 10 innings and finishing as the third-highest wicket-taker in the tournament.
* The addition of Abrar Ahmed is a significant boost for the San Francisco Unicorns ahead of the MCL's second season, which is set to kick off in mid-July 2024.

* The International Cricket Council (ICC) has granted List A status to Major League Cricket.
* The tournament has a tournament director named Geale, who was born in Canberra.
